WorkItem.Description:

WorkItem.Summary: Excel5 Writer fails when worksheet contains a formula using DAYS360 function

Comments.Message:
Note that DAYS360 has two mandatory date parameters and one optional Boolean parameter. Save works if only the two manadatory parameters are used, but returns the above error if any value is used for the optional parameter.

The optional third parameter was added for Excel 5.
Further information: Worksheet will save correctly if the third parameter value is a numeric 0 or a 1; but fail if the third parameter is a boolean True or False.

Yes, the formula parser used for Excel5 writer definitely need fixing.
Re 2nd comment: In that case I believe we may consider this bug a duplicate of 7895. Here it is noted that Boolean constants are not recognized.

I think you're right, and it is one of those cases of an advanced formula parameter.
In the interim, I've updated my partially written Function Manual to indicate that this is a problem; and that using either a numeric value or the TRUE()/FALSE() functions can serve as a workround.

There may well be other functions that also suffer from this that I haven't identified yet; but at least we have an interim solution for this.

Ok, closing this one then. When the other work item is fixed, then this issue should also disappear.
http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=7895
